title.narrative: Zero Dollar Reucrring Obligation for NGR Contracts. RPSO fee and transportation fees for PR9517000. RPSO and Transportation for PR8948973. Transportation cost for TPU contracts. Transportation Charges for PR9533192. Surcharge procurement & Trans 19GE5020P0045. RPSO Fee Charges for PR9533192. RPSO and Transporation fees for PR8948973. 'RPSO Fee charges for PR9839448. Regent Court Lease for Information Redacted 04-2021 04/2022. RPSO fee (AQM) for PR9626355 $6,093,650. Rental car for Information Redacted TDYer. Obligation Increased to cover the shortage. RPSO fee (AQM) for PR9723647 $150,000

description.narrative: This award strives to help foreign partners professionalize their military forces through educational programs and technical support, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. More specifically, this includes Zero Dollar Recurring Obligation Established to cover the cost of Nigeria's contracts.. RPSO fee and Transportation Fees for PR9517000 [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.]. PR8948973-M001 RPSO and Transportation : 19GE5020P0045: INL/Nigeria:Bedding Equipment. Transportation cost for TPU contracts. Establishing a new fiscal data to cover transportation cost of TPU contracts which was obligated under 0/5 but canceled on Sept. 30. 2020.. PR9533192 Transportation Charges [Covers transportation of U.S. Government owned property. Includes rental of cargo carrying equipment, cost of care and storage while being transported, and clearing and forwarding charges. Also includes relocation expenses for intra- and inter-building office moves.]. RPSO and Procurement Surcharge for contract # 19GE5020P0045 [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.]. RPSO Fee Charges for PR9533192 [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.]. [Covers transportation of U.S. Government owned property. Includes rental of cargo carrying equipment, cost of care and storage while being transported, and clearing and forwarding charges. Also includes relocation expenses for intra- and inter-building office moves.]. RPSO and Procurement Surcharge for contract # 19GE5020P0045 [Covers transportation of U.S. Government owned property. Includes rental of cargo carrying equipment, cost of care and storage while being transported, and clearing and forwarding charges. Also includes relocation expenses for intra- and inter-building office moves.]. [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.]. RPSO Fee charges for PR9839448 [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.]. Funds provided for the Regent Court lease for the period of 04/15/2021 thru 04/14/2022. According to the attached spreadsheet and the lease agreement, the INL portion is $76,800 for Nixon Craig residency.. RPSO fee for PR962355 for $6,093,650 [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.]. Information Redacted 's vehicle rental expenses incurred from Oct 08 to Nov 07. This amount of money need to be paid in cash. For upcoming period post will initiate a purchase request.. RPSO fee and Transportation Fees for PR9517000 [Covers transportation of U.S. Government owned property. Includes rental of cargo carrying equipment, cost of care and storage while being transported, and clearing and forwarding charges. Also includes relocation expenses for intra- and inter-building office moves.]. This action amends PR9290071 to provide $7,450.76 (NGN2,868,540.00) to replace the expired 4/5 funding on the original PR and preventing payment of the current invoice submitted by the vendor. Becuase the funding has expired, ARIBA will not allow FMO offi. RPSO fee (AQM) for PR9723647 $150,000 [Covers the costs for receiving, inspecting, stocking, pulling from stock, delivery, and other related services such as the 1 percent acquisition surcharge for executing grants and contracts above post warrant levels.].

Through educational programs and technical support, help foreign partners professionalize their military forces, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. In addition, activities assist foreign partners so that their military forces reliably demonstrate consistent support for adherence to norms of human rights; support the concept of civilian executive authority/control of the military; and have the capacity for institutional and security sector reform.

To help nations effectively establish the conditions and capacity for achieving peace, security, and stability; and for responding effectively against arising threats to national or international security and stability.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The primary goal of U.S. assistance in Nigeria is to support the country's development as a stable democracy while reducing extreme poverty. In the North East region, where the violent Boko Haram insurgency has devastated local populations, the U.S. government will continue to provide life-saving humanitarian assistance and transitional programs for stabilization. Targeted U.S. foreign assistance in Nigeria seeks to reduce extreme poverty and improve the quality of life for Nigeria's most vulnerable communities through improved governance at the federal, state, and local levels; reduced corruption; a strengthened private sector as a source of job creation; and improved quality of social service delivery. U.S. assistance will continue to address security issues by increasing the skills of security forces and advocating for institutional reform. Additionally, U.S. assistance will better position Nigeria to achieve its goal of regional leadership in West Africa via the Abuja-based Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) regional commission, while advancing U.S. policy objectives.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
